question.para: Where can I found documentation about ruby?

answer.para: Try the offical Ruby website: http://www.ruby-lang.org/

question.para: I don't have IPv6 connectivity but ZoneCheck is still using IPv6 addresses.

answer.para: ZoneCheck only look for an enabled IPv6 stack to authorize the use of IPv6 addresses. It would be a good idea to disable the IPv6 stack on your computer if you don't have the connectivity or you can use the -4 option to force IPv4 only connectivity.

question.para: I want to use an interface other than the CLI

answer.para: Use the environment variable ZC_INPUT set to your input mode, or use the command line option --INPUT=im. The input modes currently supported are CLI, CGI and GTK

question.para: The -d lvl option doesn't display earlier debugging messages

answer.para: Some debugging messages are sent before the debugging level is initialised by the command line, in this case use the environment variable ZC_DEBUG set to the desired level. But keep in mind that ZC_DEBUG will be overrided by the -d lvl option.

question.para: make failed to configure or install ZoneCheck

answer.para: You should use the GNU version of the make program, sometimes called gmake.
You should also have ruby installed, if it wasn't detected you need to force the RUBY variable to point to your ruby program (with fullpath if necessary).

question.para: I would like to easily test ZoneCheck without doing a make install

answer.para: You can define the environment variable ZC_INSTALL_PATH to the initial ZoneCheck directory.

question.para: Why do I get rubish or wrong results when doing the chk_icmp

answer.para: ZoneCheck use the command ping to perform this test, so you should set the constants ping4 and ping6 in the configuration file so that the ping is correctly invoked: stop after 5 echo request, doesn't output messages, and return an exit code of 0 in case of success.
If you are using ZoneCheck on the Window plateform, you better remove the test.
